subject: Re: [junit] Complicated Junit Test
msgSnippet: ... Yes, there is. If you can write a Java client, then you can write a JUnit test. What behavior are you trying to test? Sending the document to the correct
messageBody:
boyfrnd007 wrote:

> Hi,
> Okay!! I am responsible to test an application that periodically
> sends a microsoft document thing to my mailbox. I can specify what
> email address i can send my microsoft document to. I was wondering
> if there is a way in Junit that I can actually make sure that there
> is a document in my mailbox.

Yes, there is. If you can write a Java client, then you can write a
JUnit test.

What behavior are you trying to test? Sending the document to the
correct address? Sending the correct document? Performing an action
periodically? You can test each of these behaviors separately, and
probably should.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
